marketNews.title: RI Inflation 1.71% YoY in October 2024, Lowest Since October 2021
marketNews.content: BPS noted that Indonesia's consumer price index inflation eased to 1.71% in October 2024 (vs. September 2024: 1.84% YoY inflation), in line with consensus expectations and marking the lowest level since October 2021. Core inflation in October 2024 reached 0.22% MoM and 2.21% YoY (vs. September 2024: 0.16% MoM inflation and 2.09% YoY inflation), exceeding consensus expectations which projected core inflation at 2.1% YoY. On a monthly basis, Indonesia recorded 0.08% MoM inflation (vs. September 2024: 0.12% MoM deflation), ending a streak of monthly deflation over the previous 5 months and higher than the consensus expectation which projected flat. Nevertheless, monthly inflation in October 2024 was mainly driven by the personal care and other services expenditure group at 0.94% MoM, primarily originating from jewelry gold commodities with an inflation contribution reaching 0.06 percentage point.

marketNews.title: S&P Global: Indonesia Manufacturing PMI Contracts for Fourth Consecutive Month
marketNews.content: On the same day as the inflation data release, S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) stood at 49.2 in October 2024, flat for 2 consecutive months and marking a contraction in factory activity for the fourth consecutive month. Output and new orders continued to decline amid slack market conditions. Meanwhile, geopolitical uncertainty caused an 8-month streak of declining overseas sales. Employment also shrank for the third time in the last 4 months. Confidence also dropped to a 4-month low and well below the historical trend level.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway Summary on Inflation and Downtrading
marketNews.content: Although the streak of monthly deflation for the past 5 months has ended, it is important to note that monthly inflation was primarily driven by jewelry gold commodities in line with the global gold price increase of +4.1% MoM during October 2024. Additionally, the continuing trend of declining annual inflation could be a sign that the weakening purchasing power of the public is not yet over. The weakening public purchasing power has been reflected in the revenue decline of consumer goods issuers that act as proxies - such as UNVR and SIDO - due to the downtrading phenomenon. Furthermore, this signal is also occurring in the telecommunications sector with suppressed Average Revenue Per User (ARPU) from TLKM and ISAT. Meanwhile, the downtrading phenomenon could be a positive catalyst for consumer issuers positioned in the 'value' segment, such as Tempo Scan Pacific (TSPC) which recorded solid revenue growth in the company's important segments as we have written in Stockbit Commentary. We have also released Unboxing TSPC which you can read here.

marketNews.title: Constitutional Court Orders Employment Cluster to be Removed from the Job Creation Law
marketNews.content: The Constitutional Court on Thursday (31/10) ruled to remove the employment cluster within the Job Creation Law. Instead, the Constitutional Court ordered the DPR and the government to form a new Employment Law. The decision was made in line with the partial granting of the petition filed by labor organizations by the Constitutional Court, covering 7 major issues regarding foreign labor, fixed-term employment agreements, outsourcing, wages and minimum wages, leave, termination of employment, as well as severance pay, rights compensation pay, and length of service appreciation pay.

marketNews.title: Economist Consensus: Indonesia's Economy Likely Grew 5% YoY in 3Q24
marketNews.content: The consensus of economists surveyed by Reuters expected Indonesia's economic growth to be +5% YoY in 3Q24, slightly lower than the realization in 2Q24 at +5.05% YoY. Economists viewed that Indonesia's domestic consumption - especially in the private sector - remained solid and could offset the export weakening. On a quarterly basis, economists expected Indonesia's economic growth to be +1.6% QoQ, much lower than the realization in 2Q24 at +3.6% QoQ, as exports were suppressed due to weakening demand from China.

marketNews.title: China Manufacturing PMI Rises to 50.1 in October 2024, Entering Expansion Zone
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau noted that China's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) increased to 50.1 in October 2024 (vs. September 2024: 49.8), slightly above the consensus expectation of 50. This result marks the first time since April 2024 that China's manufacturing PMI has been in the expansion zone, driven by output growth (52 vs. September 2024: 51.2) to its highest level in 6 months, following stimulus measures provided by the Chinese government.

marketNews.title: US PCE Inflation Eases to 2.1% YoY in September 2024
marketNews.content: The Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index in the US was recorded at 2.1% YoY in September 2024 (vs. August 2024: 2.3% YoY), matching consensus expectations and marking the lowest level since February 2021. On a monthly basis, PCE inflation reached 0.2% MoM (vs. August 2024: 0.1% MoM inflation), matching consensus expectations. Meanwhile, the core PCE index - which is the long-term inflation indicator by the Fed - increased to 0.3% MoM (vs. August 2024: 0.2% MoM inflation), matching expectations and marking the highest increase in 5 months. Annually, core PCE inflation reached 2.7% YoY (vs. August 2024: 2.7% YoY inflation), exceeding consensus expectations which forecast core inflation at 2.6% YoY.

marketNews.title: Foreign Tourist Arrivals Reach 1.28 Million in September 2024 (+19.53% YoY)
marketNews.content: BPS noted that foreign tourist (wisman) arrivals to Indonesia reached 1.28 million (-4.5% MoM, +19.53% YoY) in September 2024. During 9M24, foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia increased by +20.3% YoY to 10.4 million, equivalent to 74.1% of the government's 2024 target of 14 million.

tickerNews.title: MEDC 9M24 Net Profit Decreases by 41.7% YoY, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC) recorded a net profit of 72 million US dollars (-41.2% YoY, -43.6% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 273 million US dollars (-41.7% YoY), below expectations as it equates to 68%/70% of the FY24F Stockbit/consensus estimates. Operationally, revenue in 3Q24 grew by +1.4% QoQ due to an increase in oil sales (+3.4% QoQ) and gas sales (+2.0% QoQ), with the gross profit margin rising by +110 bps QoQ to 37%. The weak net profit in 3Q24 was pressured by a decrease in profit from associates (-63% QoQ) and an increase in tax expense (+25.7% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: ACES 9M24 Net Profit Up 18% YoY, Exceeding Consensus Expectations
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) recorded a net profit of 208 billion rupiah (+14% YoY, +30% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 reach 574 billion rupiah (+18% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equates to 67% of the FY24F consensus estimate (vs. net profit seasonality of 2022-2023 only 53-64% in 9M). The increase in net profit in 3Q24 was driven by: 1) persistently high revenue growth (+13% YoY, -2% QoQ); 2) gross profit margin remaining around 48%; and 3) expansion of the operating profit margin to 13.1% (+47 bps YoY, +338 bps QoQ) from operating leverage. Excluding other revenue factors and forex losses, ACES's operating performance would look even better, with operating profit growing (+33% YoY, +58% QoQ) to 260 billion rupiah in 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: SSIA 3Q24 Net Profit Soars 339% YoY Driven by Industrial Estate Sales
tickerNews.content: Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) recorded a net profit of 123 billion rupiah (+2% QoQ, +339% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the 9M24 net profit to 228 billion rupiah (vs. 9M23: a loss of 24 billion rupiah). The performance improvement in 3Q24 was driven by revenue growth (+29% YoY, +22% QoQ) and gross profit margin expansion (+970 bps YoY, +1150 bps QoQ), driven by sales in the Industrial Estate Development segment amounting to 288 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q24: 32 billion rupiah, 3Q23: 48 billion rupiah). The increase in revenue and gross profit margin drove an increase in operating profit in 3Q24 to 343 billion rupiah (+212% QoQ, +173% YoY).

tickerNews.title: CPIN 9M24 Net Profit Down 11% YoY, Below Stockbit Expectation due to Margin Weakness in Most Segments
tickerNews.content: Charoen Pokphand Indonesia (CPIN) recorded a net profit of 619 billion rupiah (-52% QoQ, -41% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 2.4 trillion rupiah (-11% YoY), below our expectation as it only equates to 63% of the FY24F Stockbit estimate. Nevertheless, CPIN's net profit for 9M24 is still in line with consensus expectations as it equates to 74% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The decline in net profit in 3Q24 was triggered by the weakening operating profit margin in almost all segments, except for the Feed segment. The DOC segment operating profit in 3Q24 weakened to 66 billion rupiah (-81% QoQ, -77% YoY). Meanwhile, the Broiler business segment incurred an operating loss of 235 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q24: profit of 585 billion rupiah, 3Q23: loss of 59 billion rupiah). In 3Q24, the Processed Chicken segment recorded an operating profit of 14 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q24: loss of 82 billion rupiah; 3Q23: profit of 429 billion rupiah) after previously experiencing consecutive quarterly losses since 4Q23. On the positive side, the Feed segment recorded an operating profit growth to 1.1 trillion rupiah (+29% QoQ, +5% YoY) in 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: MAIN 9M24 Net Profit Jumps +684% YoY Despite 3Q24 Decline
tickerNews.content: Malindo Feedmill (MAIN) recorded a net profit of 67 billion rupiah (-67% QoQ, -62% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 359 billion rupiah (+684% YoY). The decline in net profit in 3Q24 was triggered by the weakening operating profit margin in almost all segments, except for the Feed and Food and Poultry Processing segments. The DOC segment operating profit in 3Q24 weakened to 47 billion rupiah (-69% QoQ, -69% YoY). Meanwhile, the Broiler business segment incurred an operating loss of 82 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q24: loss of 2 billion rupiah, 3Q23: loss of 67 billion rupiah). In 3Q24, the Food and Poultry Processing segment recorded an operating loss of 7 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q24: loss of 14 billion rupiah; 3Q23: loss of 9 billion rupiah), which is the smallest quarterly loss since 2023. On the positive side, the Feed segment recorded an operating profit growth to 169 billion rupiah (+14% QoQ, -24% YoY) in 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: NISP 9M24 Net Profit Climbs 25% YoY, Supported by Significant Non-Interest and Non-Operating Income Growth
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) recorded a net profit of 1.4 trillion rupiah (+17% QoQ, +44% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in a 9M24 net profit of 3.8 trillion rupiah (+25% YoY). This result was driven by Non-Interest Income which grew significantly in 3Q24 to 314 billion rupiah (+71% QoQ, +40% YoY). Additionally, Non-Operating Income also grew significantly to 373 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: 171 billion rupiah, 3Q23: 4 billion rupiah), bringing the cumulative 9M24 figure to 545 billion rupiah (vs. 9M23: 7 billion rupiah). The increase in Non-Operating Income was driven by discounts in the acquisition of PT Bank Commonwealth. On the top line, Net Interest Income (NII) in 3Q24 grew to 2.9 trillion rupiah (+8% QoQ, +15% YoY), resulting in NII for 9M24 reaching 8.1 trillion rupiah (+10% YoY). The Net Interest Margin in 3Q24 and 9M24 increased to 4.4%. On the other hand, operating expenses swelled to 1.8 trillion rupiah (+16% QoQ, +41% YoY), so operating expenses for 9M24 reached 4.7 trillion rupiah (+25% YoY). Meanwhile, gross NPL in 3Q24 improved to 1.8% (vs. 2Q24: 2%, 3Q23: 1.9%).

tickerNews.title: SMGR 3Q24 Net Profit Jumps Sevenfold QoQ due to Low Base Effect, but 9M24 Down 58% YoY
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia (SMGR) recorded a net profit of 218 billion rupiah (-74% YoY) in 3Q24, growing 7.4 times quarterly due to a low-base effect in 2Q24. This result brought the 9M24 net profit to 720 billion rupiah (-58% YoY), far below expectations as it only equates to 36% of the consensus FY24 estimate. The decline in performance in 3Q24 was caused by a decrease in revenue to 9.9 trillion rupiah (-7% YoY, +23% QoQ), so revenue during 9M24 reached only 26.3 trillion rupiah (-4.9% YoY). Furthermore, the gross profit margin in 3Q24 sharply declined year-on-year to 21.8% (vs. 2Q24: 20.5%, 3Q23: 28.5%).

tickerNews.title: INTP 9M24 Net Profit Down 17% YoY, Exceeds Consensus Expectation
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) recorded a net profit of 621 billion rupiah (+216% QoQ, +9.4% YoY) in 3Q24, driven by a low-base effect in 2Q24. This result brought the 9M24 net profit to 1.1 trillion rupiah (-17% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equates to 68% of the consensus FY24 estimate (vs. net profit for 9M21-9M23: 61% of FY). Revenue in 3Q24 grew to 5.2 trillion rupiah (+29% QoQ, +4.8% YoY), so revenue during 9M24 reached 13.3 trillion rupiah (+3% YoY). Revenue growth in 3Q24 was driven by sales volume growth to 5.5 million tons (+36% QoQ, +9.5% YoY), supported by the acquisition of Semen Grobogan. Although ASP decreased (-4% YoY, -5% QoQ), the gross profit margin in 3Q24 still grew to 34.3% (vs. 3Q23: 33.4%, 2Q24: 27.6%), driven by the low-base effect in 2Q24 and operational efficiency following a decrease in the cost of goods sold per ton (-14% QoQ, -5.1% YoY).

tickerNews.title: INKP 9M24 Net Profit Suffers 30% YoY Decline Due to Forex Losses
tickerNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (INKP) recorded a net profit of 226 million US dollars (-30% YoY) during 9M24, caused by a foreign exchange loss of 67 million US dollars. Operationally, operating profit remained positive at 529 million US dollars in 9M24 (-15% YoY) with a slightly lower margin (-120 bps YoY) due to an increase in opex. The gross profit margin increased (+10 bps YoY) to 33.1% due to a revenue decline (-10% YoY) offset by a decrease in the cost of goods sold (-10% YoY).

tickerNews.title: TKIM 9M24 Net Profit Falls 23% YoY, Operational Profit Margin Increases to 7.6%
tickerNews.content: Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia (TKIM) recorded a net profit of 103 million US dollars (-23% YoY) during 9M24, caused by a foreign exchange loss of 16 million US dollars. Operationally, operating profit remained positive at 58 million US dollars in 9M24 (+38% YoY) with an increased margin (+250 bps YoY) to 7.6%. The gross profit margin increased (+310 bps YoY) to 15.4% due to a higher decrease in the cost of goods sold (-10% YoY) compared to the revenue decrease (-7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: SMSM to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend of IDR 35 per Share
tickerNews.content: Selamat Sempurna (SMSM) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 201.5 billion rupiah or 35 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is November 7, 2024, with payment on November 21, 2024. Referring to the SMSM stock price on Friday (1/11) at 1,930 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 1.8%. Previously, SMSM had distributed the 2024 interim dividend twice, amounting to 25 rupiah per share in May 2024 and 35 rupiah per share in August 2024.

tickerNews.title: TEBE to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend of IDR 20 per Share
tickerNews.content: Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 25.7 billion rupiah or 20 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is November 8, 2024, with payment on November 21, 2024. Referring to the TEBE stock price on Friday (1/11) at 655 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 3.0%. Previously, TEBE had distributed the 2024 interim dividend twice, amounting to 15 rupiah per share in July 2024 and 15 rupiah per share in August 2024.
